metadata.title: CVE-2016-0772 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The smtplib library in CPython (aka Python) before 2.7.12, 3.x before3.4.5, and 3.5.x before 3.5.2 does not return an error when StartTLS fails,which might allow man-in-the-middle attackers to bypass the TLS protectionsby leveraging a network position between the client and the registry toblock the StartTLS command, aka a "StartTLS stripping attack."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0772` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.1
python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.1
No subscription required

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.1
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.1
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.1
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.1
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.1
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.1
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.1
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.1
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.1').
python3.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.1').
